page.title: 01Rothiesholm
page.content: Rothiesholm is practically all farmland grass and barley is mostly grown. In one of the fields there is a burial chamber which has never been excavated. On the south side there is a sandy bay. Beside it there is a links (sandy ground) in which there is a sand quarry. A house called Mount Pleasant which lies next to the links. the house used to be called St. Salvador. Behind it there is a sunken garden which is man made. Next to it there are many humps in the ground which are thought to be small houses but are probably mounds of earth dug from the sunken garden.
